required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NHFOV vs. NCPAP as a Primary Treatment to Neonatal Respiratory Distress Syndrome(NRDS)
clinical_study.official_title: Noninvasive Ventilation for Preterm Neonates With Respiratory Distress Syndrome: a Multi-center Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Guiyang Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital
Daping Hospital and the Research Institute of Surgery of the Third Military Medical University
Children's Hospital of Chongqing Medical University
Chongqing Maternal and Child Health Hospital
The Second Hospital of Shandong University

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators compared advantages and disadvantages of two forms of noninvasive respiratory support —noninvasive high-frequency ventilation (nHFV) or nasal continuous positive airway pressure (nCPAP) —as a primary mode of ventilation in premature infants with RDS．

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators enrolled preterm infants at 8 neonatal intensive care units in China. Infants were eligible if they had a gestational age of less than 35 weeks and if they were RDS candidates for noninvasive respiratory support. Infants were excluded if they were diagnosed as white lung, had congenital abnormalities, or had hypercapnia.
The parameters such as the concentration of inhalation oxygen (FiO2) were adjusted according to percutaneous oxygen saturation or blood gas analysis.The primary outcome was ratio of intubation if failed non-invasive ventilation, period of non-invasive ventilation if succeed non-invasive ventilation, morbidity of bronchopulmonary dysplasia.

primary_outcome.description: ratio of intubation for invasive ventilation if failed non-invasive ventilation

secondary_outcome.description: do brain ultrasound in the first and second week after birth,do brain MRI when corrected gestational age is 40 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence of neonatal necrotizing enterocolitis
secondary_outcome.description: the incidence and grade of neonatal necrotizing enterocolitis

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence of retinopathy of prematurity
secondary_outcome.description: the incidence and grade of retinopathy of prematurity
scores of Bayley Scales of Infant Development
the incidence and grade of bronchopulmonary dysplasia

arm_group.description: nasal continuous positive airway pressure (nCPAP) —as a primary mode of ventilation in premature infants with RDS
noninvasive high-frequency ventilation (nHFOV) as a primary mode of ventilation in premature infants with RDS

intervention.description: noninvasive high-frequency ventilation (nHFOV) as a primary mode of ventilation in premature infants with RDS
nasal continuous positive airway pressure (nCPAP) as a primary mode of ventilation in premature infants with RDS
